description: Rule pack to support OTC macrogol supply and lifestyle counselling for uncomplicated constipation.
inclusion: Adults and young people aged 12 years and over with gradual onset constipation.
No rectal bleeding, acute abdominal pain, or unexplained weight loss.
Symptoms present for less than 4 weeks without red flags.
exclusion: Sudden severe constipation with abdominal pain or vomiting.
Rectal bleeding or unexplained weight loss.
Known bowel obstruction or suspected secondary cause requiring medical assessment.
Pregnancy where prescriber review is required before laxative supply.
safetyNetting: Seek urgent care if abdominal pain, vomiting, or rectal bleeding develops.
Arrange GP review if constipation persists beyond 4 weeks despite treatment.
Return if laxatives cause diarrhoea, cramping, or electrolyte disturbance symptoms.

questions.label: Sudden onset with severe abdominal pain
Associated symptoms
questions.helper: Select all symptoms the patient reports.

fail.label: Under 12 years - refer to GP/health visitor.

result.headline: Refer - age under 12
result.summary: Paediatric constipation should be managed via GP/health visitor pathways.
actions: Signpost to GP for paediatric dosing guidance and red flag review.
Advise gradual increase in wholegrain cereals, fruit, and vegetables.
Encourage aiming for 5 portions of fruit/veg per day with adequate fluids.
Promote 6-8 glasses of water/herbal tea daily unless contraindicated.
Limit caffeine/alcohol which may worsen dehydration.
Encourage gentle exercise such as daily walking where safe.

warnings: Persistent abdominal pain - ensure escalation if no improvement in 48 hours.

trace.label: Abdominal pain present with prolonged symptoms.

pass.label: Red flag constipation presentation - urgent referral.

result.headline: Urgent referral - red flag symptoms
result.summary: Escalate for immediate medical assessment due to red flags.
actions: Arrange urgent care/A&E review and advise nil by mouth until assessed.

pass.label: Opioid use contributing - consider prescriber review.

result.headline: Refer - opioid-associated constipation
result.summary: Coordinate with prescriber for bowel regimen and opioid review.
actions: Contact GP/prescriber to review opioid dose and consider stimulant laxative.
Provide interim macrogol supply if appropriate while awaiting review.

result.headline: Refer - persistent constipation
result.summary: Symptoms beyond 2 weeks despite self-care require GP assessment.
actions: Arrange GP appointment and advise patient to maintain fluids and fibre in the interim.

trace.label: Criteria met for OTC constipation support.

result.headline: Supply macrogol sachets and lifestyle plan
result.summary: Provide macrogol and reinforce hydration, fibre, and activity guidance.
actions: Supply macrogol 13.8 g sachets: take one sachet daily, increasing to three sachets if needed (max 8/day).
Review response after 3 days and taper dose once regular soft stools achieved.
Reinforce lifestyle advice tailored to identified contributing factors.

supply.dosage: One sachet daily in 125 ml water; titrate up to three daily (max eight) as required
supply.notes: Separate macrogol doses from other oral medicines by at least 2 hours.

safetyNet: Return if no improvement within 7 days or if symptoms worsen.
Seek urgent care if vomiting, severe pain, or rectal bleeding develops.
Arrange GP review if reliance on maximum dose persists beyond 14 days.
